NSCamp

A weekend of hacking for iOS, macOS, tvOS & watchOS developers everywhere.

Get Tickets

—

About NSCamp

Founded in 2013, NSCamp is Australia’s first iOS/macOS developer camp.
Part social getaway, part hack weekend, NSCamp creates an environment where developers can work on their own projects as well as meet, collaborate with, present to and learn from like-minded people.
Deliberately unstructured, NSCamp is designed to cultivate an environment where you can:

• Spend time working your projects.
• Meet like-minded people from our community.
• Get together with others to create something new.
• Learn new techniques from your peers.
• Give adhoc talks to a friendly audience.

NSCamp is regularly held around Australia.
2016's camp will take place in Victoria at Lord Somers Camp on the picturesque Mornington Peninsula.

—

18th to the 20th of November, 2016

—

Where:

Lord Somers Camp, 1.5hrs drive from Melbourne CBD.

Directions from Flinders Street Station
Directions from Melbourne Airport

—

Who:

iOS and macOS developers from around Australia, and maybe even the world! ❤️

—

Why:

Wanna meet other devs?
Finally get that side project finished?
Create that open-source library you’ve spoken about since iPhoneOS 1.1?
Or just have a good time with other like-minded people?
